sub_title: Strategic Advisor Health Supply Chain & Director In-Country Logistics Services at Connexi
summary:
Various director and senior support management positions in Europe and Africa for blue-chip companies and renowned international relief and development organizations. Extensive experience in management and operational excellence, both in development, humanitarian and private sector. Experienced in directing both direct intervention programs and long-term post-conflict and development projects (DFID, USAID, WorldBank) with portfolio's up to 85 million USD, yearly budgets in excess of 35 million USD and both small and large (>300 staff) teams. Proficient in networking, including with media, donors, local authorities and stakeholders.

Specialties: General Senior Management; Operational Excellence; Logistics and Supply Chain Management; Government Relations and Advocacy; Humanitarian intervention, post-conflict and development project direction.

education.degree_name: Master in Finance and Business, specialisation Maritime and Logistic Sciences

profile_positions.description:
When critical commodities stay in motion, lives do too. Because better access to pharmaceuticals, mosquito nets, schoolbooks, emergency supplies, and other life-changing commodities means better access to opportunity for millions of people around the globe. Opportunity to manage their health and safety, pursue their ambitions, and lead productive, independent lives.
Connexi helps keep life moving forward by connecting people around the globe with the products they need to thrive. Our mission is simple: reliable access to critical commodities for everyone, everywhere. So we’re building on Chemonics’ unparalleled experience managing the largest health supply chain in the world, to bring supply chain excellence to all. Connexi adds a state-of-the-art technology platform and innovative private sector approaches to a deep understanding of international development and public sector requirements. 

This is how we offer cost-effective, end-to-end supply chain services that can be tailored to serve a broad range of clients and needs -- from strategic sourcing and procurement to last-mile delivery. Our people are experts in building end-to-end supply chain operations and bringing decades of supply chain transformational experience to help vast networks of in-country service providers stay aligned to keep things moving on the ground. Because coordinating local partners is key to delivering on promises in the world’s most hard-to-reach places.

Supply chains not only connect people to products. They are the bridge between ambitious goals and meaningful outcomes, for the donors, governments, companies, and non-profits we serve, and the thousands of customers counting on them to deliver. Together, let’s set a new standard: a day when on time, happens every time.
profile_positions.title: Strategic Advisor Health Supply Chain & Director In-Country Logistics Services

profile_positions.description:
- Providing thought leadership and strategic input for the creation and implementation of the Procurement and Logistics Technology Centre
- Developing the product portfolio for Global and In-Country Procurement and Logistics Services
- Providing strategic and tactical input to define and implement the structure, processes and systems for the PLTC
- Defining the functional requirements for a new state-of-the-art technology to provide Global and In-Country Procurement and Logistics Services in the most effective and efficient way
profile_positions.title: Strategic Advisor Health Supply Chain - PLTC

profile_positions.description:
Advising Chemonics' to develop their Health Supply Chain Strategy to ensure it will become the global leader in Health Supply Chain services and technical assistance, using private sector approaches for an end-to-end supply chain operation.
Provided the thought and operational leadership and advice to create a new division based on an operational and technological best practices to deliver high-performing, reliable, end-to-end supply chain services at scale, across multiple clients and type of commodities, at a competitive cost.
profile_positions.title: Supply Chain Systems Growth Team Strategic Advisor

profile_positions.description:
•	Lead the 4PL Transformation for PPM (Pooled Porcurement Mechanism)/PFSCM to be aligned with the client’s needs and expectations, and in function of the global strategy of PFSCM
•	Establish the framework for PPM’s freight operations and the systems and processes with contracted logistics suppliers
•	Lead analysis of the contracted logistics suppliers’ performance
•	Manage clients relations for all matters related to Freight and Logistics
•	Contribute to PFSCM’s last mile customer delivery strategy and freight optimisation initiatives
profile_positions.title: PFSCM Logistics Services Manager In-Country

profile_positions.description:
Key Achievements:

•	Managed a 37 million USD program through various extensions for transition preparedness in 2016
•	Managed various technical assistances with two main impact results in 2 years:
o	Stock-out reduction from 91% to 7%
o	On-time delivery of central pharmacy from 2% to 70%
•	Implemented a Decentralised Supply Chain Management component with 5 regional field offices covering the entire territory of Côte d’Ivoire (20 health regions, 82 health districts), with a focus on capacity building and stock-out reduction
•	Started and finished construction of a state-of-the-art warehouse of 4000 m2 for the central pharmacy
•	Provided direct technical assistance to start up the equivalent of a Logistical Management Unit (CN-CAM) within the MoH, setting up a permanent technical secretariat overseeing the quantification, supply plan management and stock-out alert systems of all MoH programs
•	Direct supervision and management of Field Office Managed Procurement activities, with yearly budget of about 29 million USD
•	Managed and oversaw various workstreams for technical assistance:
o	Renovation of 15 district pharmacies
o	System and process optimisation of the central pharmacy after the transformation of PSP (Pharmacy de la Santé Publique) to Nouvelle PSP, to help achieve the goal of becoming a regional center of excellence
o	Quantification of ARV’s and lab commodities for the PNLS (Programme National de Lutte contre le Sida)
o	Collection and destruction of about 45 tons of expired and non-usable ARV’s and lab commodities on peripheral and central level
o	Pilot project and planned roll-out of eLMIS (electronic Logistics Management Information System)
o	National Supply Chain Assessment as part of a global international exercise, used and adapted nationally for the 3-year Strategic National Plan for the Supply Chain
•	Prepared the Country Program for close-out and transition to GHSC/PSM scheduled for Oct-Nov 2016
profile_positions.title: Country Director

profile_positions.description:
Key achievements

• Streamlined internal operational and commercial processes and systems
• Turned operational loss-making organization into trade profit generating country branch
• Implemented new operations for export of largest African zinc mine with fleet estimated at 120 trucks at full exploration for about 5,000 MT per week; contract estimated at 55 million EUR over 7 years
• Preparation of opening full separate legal entity in Ivory Coast as of January 2014
• Rightsizing exercise of country branch to align workforce with group requirements
• New clients signed on in key markets of commodity export and infrastructure projects
profile_positions.title: Managing Director Burkina Faso & Ivory Coast

profile_positions.description:
Since 2007, Bertling DRC, based in Lubumbashi, is one of the main freight forwarders for mainly mining and mining-related companies in the Katanga province in the Democratic Republic of Congo. It specialises in project cargo and high-value cargo, providing all the services that satisfy demanding clients, in cooperation and coordination with the other Bertling African offices, and the sub-sahara HQ offices in Johannesburg, SA.

Realisations:

• Consolidated the existing client portfolio, extending the business with high-potential growth clients
• Moved office to increase visibility and improve client representation
• Extended and adapted the operation department structure to increase operational quality and create a client-focused approach
• Set up a service provider management structure
• Standardized and documented the existing and new internal processes and systems
• Profit target 2012 achieved end of May
• Operational cost reduction of 6% due to improved Cost Control mechanism
• Internal file handling leadtime reduced with 85%
• Invoice accuracy and timeliness increased to 96%
profile_positions.title: Country Director Democratic Republic of Congo

profile_positions.description:
Realisations

Programmatic management
•	Ensured a 4-year World Bank health program in cooperation with the Congolese government (PARSS) finished with all expected deliverables
•	Assured that the DfID Community Driven Reconstruction program (Tuungane) transitioned smoothly from phase 1 to phase 2 in both Haute Katanga and Tanganyika
•	Started up two more health programs in cooperation with USAID and the Swedish Government (SIDA)
•	Started up an 5-year education program in cooperation with USAID

Growth management
•	Adapted the management and operational structure to allow growth transitions:
o	Staff: 185 personnel to 340
o	Operational Budget: 13 million USD to 25 million USD
o	Portfolio: 32 million USD to 83 million USD
o	Geographical: 2 to 3 field offices, covering about 40% of the province

Risk management
•	Reduced Internal Audit Risk Rating from High Risk to Moderate Risk
profile_positions.title: Provincial Director, Katanga, DRC

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:

Strategic Planning, Program Implementation and Evaluation
•	Review and revise IRC's strategic plan in Chad to better identify strategy and ways to support local organizational capacity, including programming external to the camp and integration and/or resettlement of the affected population
	
	Fund Raising and Grant Management
•	Pursue opportunities for IRC to expand its programming in accordance with the IRC Chad strategy documents and in line with donor regulations

Policy Implementation
•	Insure the even and consistent implementation of IRC policies and procedures as described in the IRC Field Operations Manual
		
	Human Resource Management
•	Maximize the use of national and refugee human resources in the delivery of IRC Chad's projects and actively pursue strategies for nationalization and enhanced decision making for refugee employees
	
	Security, Health & Safety
•	Develop and implement security policies addressing local conditions, and maintain an evacuation plan which is familiar to local staff and headquarters making use of the information provided in the security protocols in the IRC Field Operations Manual

	Financial Management
•	Assure IRC Chad office provides quality, timely financial, logistical, and administrative support
•	Manage and monitor the country office budget monitoring and control systems to avoid any over expenditures and/or disallowed costs.
profile_positions.title: Country Director, Chad

profile_positions.location: Great Lakes Region; Madagascar; Rwanda, Sudan
profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:
•	Conduct system reviews to verify that policies and procedures are well documented, standardized, disseminated, and in accordance with IRC and donor policy requirements.
•	Verify progress on procurement plans for key projects
•	Provide guidance to country offices on staff retention and development.
•	Act as first line advisory resource for (operational) Coordinators. Identify staff knowledge areas that require strengthening and work with the Director Logistics to provide the appropriate training or guidance
•	Work with the RD and Deputy Vice President, Planning and Operations, to develop a core set of metrics to measure and assess operational efficiency and success.
•	Maintain key relationships with IPD regional and country teams, as well as the HQ-based Regional Controller, Director of Logistics, and Deputy Vice President, Planning and Operations.

Specific roving assignments:
•	Sudan: Deputy Director Operations Sudan; June 2006 – August 2006
•	Rwanda: Country Administrator; January 2007 – February 2007
profile_positions.title: Operations and Roving Advisor/Great Lakes Region/Madgascar/Rwanda/Sudan

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:
•	Oversee financial, administrative and logistical management
•	Ensure proper management of 160 national staff and 4 expatriate staff
•	Liaise with donors, public authorities, other agencies and key stakeholders
•	Ensure all goals and objectives of programs are met in a timely and effective manner, focusing on the repatriation and resettlement activities of returnees
•	Define country programs and budget
•	Liaise with Headquarters in New-York to ensure that all policies and procedures are properly implemented
•	Ensure financial stability and viability of the country program
•	Managing the office through the close-down of the entire country program  

•	Oversee all logistical/procurement systems for the country program
•	Provide support for proposal and budget development for new and current programs
•	Supervise logistics staff in their daily functions
•	Manage the Field Coordinator and Logistical Coordinator in Betou
•	Coordinate all activities regarding the repatriation operations from RoC to RDC
profile_positions.title: Logistic-Administrative Coordinator/Repatriation Coordinator; Country Director / Congo-Brazzaville

profile_positions.location: Belgium; Netherlands; France; UK; Republic of Congo
profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:
•	Analyse opportunities for and implement change management programmes with clear measurable targets at fixed time fixed price
•	Knowledge specialisation in Supply Chain Management-Planning-Logistics
•	Manage Action Teams with focus on results

Realisations:
•	Preparation for work stream Multi-Project Management at large industrial assembly company
•	Analysis of planning and scheduling, inventory management and resourcing at pharmaceutical company; pre-development of general integrated scheduling tool for packaging division
•	Two work streams at large oil- and gas company in fields of Logistics and Organisational Design; Full on-shore operations organisation re-structured and implemented; savings in logistics field generated of 600 kEuro
•	Analysis of Supply Chain Process and Customer Relations Management at multi-national chemical company
•	Analysis of production process and planning/scheduling process in pharmaceutical company; set-up of workstream of scheduling, enabling development and implementation of scheduling tool; link scheduling with overall Supply Chain Management Planning
•	Development and implementation of scheduling tool and linked Management System in pharmaceutical company, ensuring company Supply Chain Management vision and objectives are achieved; development and implementation of Short Interval Control; Plan Attainment from base 58% brought to 90%
•	Implementation and assuring sustainability of Management System within large manufacturer of airplane engines; improvement and quality-results-control of Industrial Development Process
•	Design and implementation of integrated planning on local business-unit level of multi-national oil company; planning includes production planning, maintenance planning, logistics planning, main stops; integration of site-planning off-shore with planning on-shore
profile_positions.title: Senior Management Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:
•	Perform and monitor the high-level planning and forecasting for the European External Logistics for production parts 
•	Organise the new pan-European logistics system in view of the new upcoming plants

profile_positions.title: Logistic Specialist
